description: Two Romano-British 'villages' that are treated as a single site in the literature due to their nearness. The more easterly of the two contained a central enclosure which was described as 'unusual', and suggested as a possible shrine.
bibliography: Hawley, and Goddard. “Romano-British Villages on Upavon/Rushall Downs, Excavated by Lt Col. Hawley.” The Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Magazine 42 (1924).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Rushall Down/Charlton Down & Upavon Down (Wiltshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
